Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior, from left: dividing band of vertical maeander flanked by vertical strips of dot and billet; painted decoration consisting of hind leg of lion to right; spiked swastika with rounded angles and spirals as filling ornament; below, part of undetermined pattern in handle zone.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 71, p. 236 no. 156)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0151) (phase 2)
